main

Class GameRun_F

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameRun_F
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Key_H
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameRun

    public class GameRun_F
extends java.lang.Object
implements Key_H
    The GameRun_F class implements the Key_H interface and serves as the main game loop and state manager for the game. This class handles various game states, rendering, and user interactions.

    Dependencies:

    • DirectGraphics
    • Graphics
    • MainCanvas
    • Image
    • Monster
    • Map
    • PointerKey
    • Ui
    • Ms
    • Constants_H
    • Sound

    Usage:

    This class is used to manage the game state, render graphics, handle user input, and manage game data such as monsters, items, and game settings.

    Methods:

    • initGraphics(Graphics _g): Initializes the main graphics context.
    • initOffG(): Initializes the off-screen graphics context.
    • setStringB(String str, int w, int mode): Sets the string buffer based on the mode.
    • getSIndexW(String str): Calculates the width of a string with special characters.
    • drawZero(int x, int y, int anchor, int color): Draws a string at the specified location with the given color.
    • drawZero(String str, int y): Draws a string at the specified location.
    • gogoWord(String string, int x, int y, int w, int color, int strT, int speed): Animates a string horizontally.
    • gogoWordM(String string, int y, int w, int color, int strT, int speed): Animates a string horizontally with a different method.
    • setGogoWord(): Sets the gogo word for animation.
    • drawSnare5(int x, int y): Draws a snare animation.
    • showString(StringBuffer[] showS, int y, int offx, int mode): Displays a string buffer array on the screen.
    • showString(String string, int y, int offx): Displays a string on the screen.
    • showStringM(String str, int x, int y, int num, int c): Displays a string with multiple lines.
    • showStringM_(String str, int x, int y, int num, int c): Displays a string with multiple lines (alternative method).
    • drawHelpStr(Graphics g2, StringBuffer[] help_strbuff, int line_num, int x, int y, int anchor): Draws help strings on the screen.
    • drawSrcLine(Graphics g2, int y, int h, int piece, boolean dir, boolean mode): Draws a source line animation.
    • createString(String name): Creates a string from a resource file.
    • createData(int no): Creates data from a resource file.
    • setAction_str(String[] temp_str): Sets the action strings.
    • drawMenu(StringBuffer[] menu, int x, int y, int w): Draws a menu on the screen.
    • drawSelectMenu(Object[] menu, int x, int y, int w, int dis, int cn, int s_f): Draws a selectable menu on the screen.
    • drawSelectMenu_(Object[] menu, int x, int y, int w, int dis, int cn, int s_f): Draws a selectable menu on the screen (alternative method).
    • setPauseS(int mode): Sets the pause menu strings based on the mode.
    • drawPauseMenu(int x, int y, int w, int h): Draws the pause menu on the screen.
    • saveMon(ByteArrayOutputStream byteArray, Monster mon): Saves a monster to a byte array.
    • loadMon(ByteArrayInputStream byteArray, Monster mon, byte[][] data): Loads a monster from a byte array.
    • saveMon(int flag): Saves the current monsters to persistent storage.
    • loadMon(int flag, byte[][] data): Loads the monsters from persistent storage.
    • saveInfoList(): Saves the monster info list to persistent storage.
    • loadInfoList(): Loads the monster info list from persistent storage.
    • loadRmsOther(): Loads other game settings from persistent storage.
    • setMaxTakes(boolean bb): Sets the maximum number of takes and monsters based on the game settings.
    • isMyLevel(boolean bb): Checks the player's level and updates it if necessary.
    • saveItem(): Saves the current items to persistent storage.
    • loadItem(): Loads the items from persistent storage.
    • initRmsOther(): Initializes other game settings.
    • loadRmsSms(): Loads SMS settings from persistent storage.
    • loadRmsNidus(): Loads nidus settings from persistent storage.
    • getRid(int i): Gets the rid value for a given index.
    • getNid(int i): Gets the nid value for a given index.
    • getNLevel(int i): Gets the nidus level for a given index.
    • getNexp(int i, int n): Gets the nidus experience for a given index and level.
    • addNidus(int id): Adds a nidus to the list.
    • delNidus(int i): Deletes a nidus from the list.
    • setNidusExp(int exp): Sets the nidus experience.
